title: Cedar Breaks National Monument: Current Conditions
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Current Conditions              Current Conditions          Alerts    No alerts at this time     Â    Weather You can check out the Weather Forecast for Cedar Breaks National Monument for current and future weather conditions. How is weather affecting Cedar Breaks? You can sneak a peek on UDOT's nearby webcam. Select "Brian Head" under the location tab.  What is Open/Available Right Now? Cedar Break National Monument scenic road, State Route 148, is currently OPEN and drivable to all types of vehicles. Road conditions are subject to weather and may be icy at times. See UDOT's seasonal roads page to find current information on State Route 148. You can also call the Utah Department of Transportation (UDOT) at any time, day or night. Dial 511 if you're a Utah resident or 866-551-8824 if calling from a phone based outside of Utah. The following facilities and services are available. State Route 148, Point Supreme Campground, Restrooms, Visitor Center, Bookstore, Ranger Programs, Overlooks & Trails. (Sections of all park trails are currently muddy and snowy. We do not recommend hiking unless wearing waterproof shoes with good traction.) What is Closed Right Now? All facilities and services are currently open and available.
